title: Powerful Integers - Hash Table - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given two positive integers x and y, an integer is powerful if it is equal to x^i + y^j for some integers i >= 0 and j >= 0.
Return a list of all powerful integers that have value less than or equal to bound.
You may return the answer in any order.  In your answer, each v

title: Occurrences After Bigram - Hash Table - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given words first and second, consider occurrences in some text of the form "first second third", where second comes immediately after first, and third comes immediately after second.
For each such occurrence, add "third" to the answer, and return the answer.

title: Unique Number of Occurrences - Hash Table - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an array of integers arr, write a function that returns true if and only if the number of occurrences of each value in the array is unique. Example 1: Input: arr = [1,2,2,1,1,3]
Output: true
Explanation: The value 1 has 3 occurrences, 2 has 2 and 3 has 1. No two valu

title: Merge Two Sorted Lists - Linked List - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a new sorted list. The new list should be made by splicing together the nodes of the first two lists. Example: Input: 1->2->4, 1->3->4
Output: 1->1->2->3->4->4

title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List - Linked List - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given a sorted linked list, delete all duplicates such that each element appear only once. Example 1: Input: 1->1->2
Output: 1->2
Example 2: Input: 1->1->2->3->3
Output: 1->2->3

content:

title: Remove Linked List Elements - Linked List - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Remove all elements from a linked list of integers that have value val. Example: Input:  1->2->6->3->4->5->6, val = 6
Output: 1->2->3->4->5

title: Palindrome Linked List - Linked List - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given a singly linked list, determine if it is a palindrome. Example 1: Input: 1->2
Output: false
Example 2: Input: 1->2->2->1
Output: true
Follow up:
Could you do it in O(n) time and O(1) space?

title: Delete Node in a Linked List - Linked List - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Write a function to delete a node in a singly-linked list. You will not be given access to the head of the list, instead you will be given access to the node to be deleted directly.
It is guaranteed that the node to be deleted is not a tail node in the list.

content:
